project.description: This is a generic Job to be executed by a polling script that will generate series information for series to run against.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SERIES_ID
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This will be the ID of the series to poll

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SERIES_URL
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: URL of the series from Patchwork

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SUBMITTER
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Full name of the series submitter

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SUBMITTER_EMAIL
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Email address to which the bot will send email

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SMTP_SERVER
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.defaultValue: SMTP server to be used for sending email

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SMTP_SERVERPORT
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.defaultValue: Port to connect to the SMTP server

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SMTP_ENCRYPTION
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.defaultValue: Encryption type used on the SMTP server

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SMTP_PASSWORD
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.defaultValue: Password of the robot. Careful with this.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# this gets all the patches
git config user.name "0-day Robot" git config user.email "$ROBO_EMAIL" git config sendemail.smtpserver "$SMTP_SERVER" git config sendemail.smtpuser "$SMTP_USER" git config sendemail.smtppass "$SMTP_PASSWORD" git config sendemail.smtpserverport "$SMTP_SERVERPORT" git config sendemail.smtpencryption "$SMTP_ENCRYPTION"
I=0
curl -s -f "$SERIES_URL" > info.json
COVER_LETTER_URL=$(jq -rc '.cover_letter.url' info.json) if [ "$COVER_LETTER_URL" != "null" ]; then COVER_LETTER_MBOX=$(jq -rc '.mbox' info.json) curl -s -f "$COVER_LETTER_MBOX" -o "cover_letter.info" fi
for patch in $(jq -rc '.patches[].url' info.json); do curl -s -f "${patch}" > patch.json patch_mbox=$(jq -rc '.mbox' patch.json) patch_subject=$(jq -rc '.name' patch.json | sed 's@/@ of @') if echo $patch_subject | grep -o 'RFC' >/dev/null 2>&1; then touch skip.done fi curl -s "$patch_mbox" -o "$(printf %04d $I).patch" I=$((I+1)) done

OLD_IFS="$IFS" IFS='' echo "From: 0-day Robot <$ROBO_EMAIL> To: $SUBMITTER <$SUBMITTER_EMAIL> Date: $(date +"%a, %e %b %Y %T %::z")" > tmp.email.txt IFS="$OLD_IFS"
if [ -f skip.done ]; then exit 0 fi
if [ "$UPLOAD_GIT_REPO" ]; then git remote add upload_repo "$UPLOAD_GIT_REPO" git remote update git checkout -b "series_${SERIES_ID}" fi
#set up checkpatch. checkpatch will check code styling and common spelling errors in comments curl -s -o checkpatch.pl 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/torvalds/linux/master/scripts/checkpatch.pl' chmod 755 checkpatch.pl echo 'DPDK_CHECKPATCH_PATH=./checkpatch.pl' > .develconfig
#enable codespell sed -i 's/options="$options --show-types"/options="$options --show-types --codespell"/g' devtools/checkpatches.sh
for patch in *.patch; do PATCH_SUBJECT=$(git mailinfo /dev/null /dev/null < $patch | grep Subject: | sed 's@Subject: @@') ERRORS=''
# for each patch
# apply it git am --signoff -q -3 "$patch" 2>&1 | tee tmp.gitam.log if egrep -i '(warn|err|Patch failed)' tmp.gitam.log >/dev/null 2>&1; then IFS='' ERRORS="$ERRORS
git-am: $(cat tmp.gitam.log) " IFS="$OLD_IFS" echo "Skip this patch" > skip.done fi rm tmp.gitam.log
if [ ! -f skip.done ]; then # check it for patch issues ./devtools/checkpatches.sh "$patch" 2>&1 | tee tmp.checkpatch.log if egrep -i '(warn|err)' tmp.checkpatch.log >/dev/null 2>&1; then IFS='' ERRORS="$ERRORS
checkpatch: $(cat tmp.checkpatch.log) " IFS="$OLD_IFS" fi rm tmp.checkpatch.log
if [ "$UPLOAD_GIT_REPO" ]; then git push -u upload_repo "series_${SERIES_ID}" fi
# now configure the system (make defconfig && make all) 2>&1 | tee tmp.build.log if egrep '^(make: \*\*\* \[all\] Error)' tmp.build.log >/dev/null 2>&1; then IFS='' ERRORS="$ERRORS
build: $(tail -n25 tmp.build.log) " IFS="$OLD_IFS" echo "Skip this patch" > skip.done fi rm tmp.build.log fi
if [ "X$ERRORS" != "X" ]; then cp tmp.email.txt email.txt echo "Subject: Re: ${PATCH_SUBJECT}" >> email.txt MSG_ID=$(grep 'Message-Id:' "$patch" | cut -d: -f2) echo "In-Reply-To: $MSG_ID" >> email.txt echo "References: $MSG_ID" >> email.txt echo "" >> email.txt echo "Bleep bloop. Greetings $SUBMITTER, I am a robot and I have tried out your patch." >> email.txt echo "Thanks for your contribution." >> email.txt echo "" >> email.txt echo "I encountered some error that I wasn't expecting. See the details below." >> email.txt IFS='' echo "$ERRORS" >> email.txt IFS="$OLD_IFS" echo "" >> email.txt echo "Please check this out. If you feel there has been an error, please email aconole@bytheb.org" >> email.txt echo "" >> email.txt echo "Thanks," >> email.txt echo "0-day Robot" >> email.txt
git send-email --suppress-from --cc="dev@openvswitch.org" email.txt fi done
